title: Manipal December 2021—2-day birding blitz
text:
06:15 Deboard bus in Manipal
Walk to End Point hotspot (2.7 km, < 30 min)
06:45 End Point
Walk around for 2 h. 40-50 species possible. Herga and Shettybettu for later. RuWo, babblers (RuBa, DFBa, ISBa), thrushes (OHTh), GrJu, starlings (MaSt), bulbuls (FTBu), MPHo, AFBl
08:45 Start walking to ZoomCar pickup (Country Inn)
09:00 Arrive at ZoomCar pickup
Also find light and quick breakfast around.
10:00 Depart in ZoomCar
10:15 Manipal Lake (Map)
Try to finish in 1 h. Around 30-35 species. Main tick: Tufted Duck.
11:15 Leave for Gujjarbettu paddyfields
11:45 Gujjarbettu paddyfields (Map) (Hotspot)
Spend 30 mins scanning for interesting birds. Waders, raptors, hornbill, munias, etc. Then move to Malpe.
12:30 Malpe Port (Map) (Hotspot)
Walk along beach, watch rocks for congregations of terns and waders. Around 20-25 species. Jaeger, gulls, terns, WRHe, StHe, WBSE, frigatebirds(?). Spend around one hour here, then move for lunch.
13:30 Lunch (max. 45 mins) from Malpe
14:15 Malpe sandbar
Move south along sandbar, possible stops at multiple locations. Look out for interesting flocks. Move south till Mattu Beach area, possible quick stop there.
17:00 Start for Andar
50 km, roughly 1.5 h w/o stops. Possible stop for sunset en route. Maybe find dinner too.
20:00 Arrive at accommodation (Map)
If no dinner yet, find around. Night walk around 2 h.
23:00 Sleep



05:00 Wake up!
Freshen up quick and possibly stop for chai. Ready to leave by 05:30 or 05:45.
06:00 Short birding around farm
Can try for thrushes and babblers. Maybe some fancy warblers/flycatchers. Possible: MaBa, MGHo, LiSp, GFGP, YFGP, MIPi, HSWo, SpPi, BEKi, Malabar Trogon!
07:00 Leave for Mattu beach
Possible stops en route, like Murathagudde viewpoint. Breakfast on the way.
09:30 Mattu beach to Malpe beach
Relaxed but focussed birding along beach/sandbar for pelagic and shorebirds. Multiple stops and lunch en route.
14:00 Leave for Manipal
14:30 Drop off car
And walk 3-4 km from dropoff to Herga.
15:00 Herga, Shettybettu
May not be possible to explore all places (Herga, Shettybettu, Saralebettu) fully.
Common Grasshopper-Warbler seen in 2017–18 winter on Herga Temple Road
19:00 Walk to Manipal and dinner
And relax till bus!
20:45 Board bus!

title: Texas Coast, Spring Break 2025
text: Five-day trip during LSU Spring Break 2025. Here’s our trip report.

title: Texas Coast, Spring Break 2025
text:
Articles/reports

Trip report: Michael Plauche, southern TX, 27 Feb-3 Mar 2025. Many rarities.
Trip report: The Birding Bros Spring Break 2025
Trip report: Lady Birders Weekend, Rio Grande Valley, Feb 2025
Trip report: Houston area and Edwards Plateau, April 2024
Trip report: Honza & Jakub, FL+TX, 25 Feb-10 Mar 2025.
Tips for Spring Birding in Galveston
Birding in Texas

title: Texas Coast, Spring Break 2025
text:
Day 1 (2 April)

09:00-10:00: Depart BTR to Hidalgo/Cameron (10 h drive w/o stops)
Vehicle pick-up at 9:00, but by the time we leave BTR after everything, it may be ~10:00.

Slingshot to Rio Grande. 10 h drive; with a lunch break and ~2 h of buffer, a total of ~12 h.
Reach Lower TX coast by night (at motel around 22:00)

title: Texas Coast, Spring Break 2025
text:
Day 2 (3 April)

Spend entire day in the lower Rio Grande valley covering multiple parks and nation refuges multiple times.

title: Texas Coast, Spring Break 2025
text:
Day 3 (4 April)

Little bit more of the lower RGV depending on how the first day goes

Head towards South Padre Island and cover the beach and others till late evening
Perhaps our luck pans out a Short-eared Owl?

title: Texas Coast, Spring Break 2025
text:
Day 4 (5 April)

Start as early as possible!
Towards Central TX coast (Galveston, 6 h drive) but this day will focus on birding along the way (Corpus Christi, Aransas Wildlife refuge etc.)
Reach Galveston/Houston area by night

title: Texas Coast, Spring Break 2025
text:
Day 5 (6 April)

Morning to evening: Central TX coast (spots around Houston area)
Move northeast as day progresses (High Island, Sabine Woods)
Start towards BTR by dusk from Sabine (chance for nocturnals), to reach BTR by 22:00-23:00.

title: Texas Coast, Spring Break 2025
text:
Day 6 (7 April)

Start early towards Mississippi/Grand Isle and also, decide on how much time we wanna spend on birding v/s we could make use of the car and go grocery shopping etc before the end of the day. ?????

title: Karthik’s Trip Planning Notebook
text:
This is a Quarto website.
To learn more about Quarto websites visit https://quarto.org/docs/websites.

title: Birding Double Day Trip 12th-13th Feb 2021
text:
This document was originally created by Honza Grünwald. I have just collated it into my collection of travel planning logs.

12th February, Sunset 17:14
1030 meeting at the Central Station Prague
1100-1300 Vltava river (Prague centre)
Certain: Mew Gull
Possible: Herring Gull, Greater Scaup, Peregrine Falcon
1330-1335 Malešická spalovna (Prague)
Possibe: Peregrine Falcon
1350-1420 Slatina pond (Prague)
Possible: Jack Snipe, Bearded Reedling, Common Redpoll
1440-1500 Vyšehořovice (field)
Possible: Crested Lark, Peregrine Falcon, Rough-Legged Buzzard, Northern Goshawk, Corn Bunting
1545-1715 Křičeň-Staré Ždánice-Oplatil (fields and lakes)
Possible: Wood Lark, Snow Bunting, Tundra Swan, Rough-Legged Buzzard, Norhtern Goshawk, Hen Harrier – in the fields; Arctic Loon, Greater Scaup, Velvet Scoter, Tundra Bean Goose – on water.


13th February, Sunrise 7:15, Sunset 17:16
0515 Wake up!!!
0545 Departure
0715-0945 Nechranice (reservoir)
Possible: Arctic Loon, Red-throated Loon, Tundra Bean Goose, Red-breasted Merganster, Greater Scaup, Velvet Scoter, Horned Grebe, Mew Gull, Herring Gull, Water Pipit, Corn Bunting, Common Redpoll, Wood Lark, Merlin, Northern Goshawk, Greater Black-backed Gull
1015-1100 Kyjice / Zaječice (reservoir)
Possible: Arctic Loon, Red-throated Loon, Tundra Bean Goose, Red-breasted Merganster, Greater Scaup, Velvet Scoter, Horned Grebe, Mew Gull, Herring Gull, Water Pipit, Corn Bunting, Common Redpoll, Wood Lark, Merlin, Northern Goshawk
1130-1430 Most (reservoir)
Possible: Arctic Loon, Red-throated Loon, Tundra Bean Goose, Red-breasted Merganster, Greater Scaup, Velvet Scoter, Horned Grebe, Mew Gull, Herring Gull, Water Pipit, Corn Bunting, Common Redpoll, Wood Lark, Merlin, Northern Goshawk, Greater Black-backed Gull, Great Bittern, Bearded Reedling, Hen Harrier
1500-1600 Lenešice (fields, pond)
Possible: Whooper Swan
